metadata.synopsis:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.

0.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
0.text: Look at that. Got my useless old man back.
0.context: NodeContext: With bitterness in her voice.

179.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
179.context: NodeContext: With bitterness in her voice.

189.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
189.text: His hands are empty as a hole - will have to send him back out soon enough.
189.context: NodeContext: With bitterness in her voice.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: It's a miracle he survived. You should take him home.
194.context: NodeContext: With bitterness in her voice.

66.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
66.text: Please. Baelen's got a job to do. We can leave when he's done it.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: Seems like there's no love lost between the two of you.
159.context: NodeContext: With bitterness in her voice.

150.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
150.text: Love? Hah. Never heard of it.

262.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
262.text: Baelen's meek now, but he used to be a rotten old bastard. Treated me like an old shoe for seventy years.

136.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
136.text: Losing his mind was the only good he ever did by me.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: This is dangerous territory. You must be down here for a reason.
37.context: NodeContext: With bitterness in her voice.

103.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
103.text: Collecting noblestalk. Valuable mushroom. We've a shop in Baldur's Gate. The locals go mad for it.
103.context: NodeContext: With bitterness in her voice.

115.speaker: Player
115.context: NodeContext: With bitterness in her voice.

53.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
53.text: Nearly nothing it can't cure. Blindness, poison, hair loss...

188.speaker: Player
188.text: Could it cure Baelen's memory loss?
188.context: NodeContext: With bitterness in her voice.

42.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
42.text: Probably. But Baelen in his right mind wasn't worth half a half of noblestalk.
42.context: NodeContext: With bitterness in her voice.

111.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
111.text: I know him better than anyone. Got the scars to prove it.
111.context: NodeContext: With bitterness in her voice.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: What about that gnome, Thulla? Could it cure her?
109.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

242.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
242.text: Might do. But why bother? Thing sells in town for enough to make your eyes bulge.

255.speaker: Player
255.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

79.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
79.text: Ah. To no surprise of mine, you're more competent than Baelen.
79.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

121.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
121.text: Go on, then. Hand it over.
121.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

214.speaker: Player
214.text: Why do you need it so badly?

68.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
68.text: We - I - run a shop called Bonecloak's in Baldur's Gate.

48.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
48.text: Baelen nearly sunk the shop to pay for drink, when he was of his own mind.

98.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
98.text: If I can put noblestalk on the shelves, it might allow us to hang on a little longer.

216.speaker: Player
216.text: What will you do with it?

149.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
149.text: Sell it, what else? Worth more than its weight in gold to folk back in Baldur's Gate. There ain't much it can't cure.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: How much is it worth to you?

127.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
127.text: Loads. But I haven't got anything to offer for it. I'm counting on this shroom for that.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: Now that's settled, tell me what you're really doing down here.

279.speaker: Player
279.text: You ought to sell the dimwit. A little hard labour could be whipped out of him.

146.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
146.text: I've been tempted, but wouldn't want to damage my reputation by selling on such rubbish wares.

84.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
84.text: Just leave me, I said. You've done enough damage already.
84.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

139.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
139.text: Baelen's got a few minutes to get himself out of that shroom field 'fore I pack up.
139.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: What are you doing down here?

226.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
226.text: Right now? Waiting for my idiot husband's return. 'Less you've seen him, we don't have much to discuss.

157.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
157.text: What? Now Baelen's dead, I've got to get myself moving. Empty-handed an' all...
157.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

165.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
165.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I met Baelen in a field of deadly mushrooms.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Baelen died in a field of toxic mushrooms.

182.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
182.text: Away. Now. You've leeched on my misery plenty already.
182.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

185.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
185.text: What? Now Baelen's dead, I've got to get myself moving.
185.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

96.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
96.text: You come across a noblestalk mushroom about, you give it here. Gods know I've earned it.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Why is a mushroom so important to you?

144.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
144.text: We've a shop in Baldur's Gate. The locals go mad for it.

217.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
217.text: No point in lingering now I've got the noblestalk.

11.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
11.text: No point in lingering. Not after you swiped what we came for.

206.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
206.text: We'll be clearing out, soon enough. Empty-handed, of course.
206.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

221.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
221.text: Seems the 'shrooms are letting in more people every day.
221.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

47.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
47.text: You see a fella on his own on your way in? Dwarf. Baelen's his name.
47.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: What are you doing down here?
134.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

275.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
275.text: Right now? Waiting for that idiot Baelen's return. 'less you've seen him, we don't have much to discuss.

245.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
245.text: Right now? Waiting for my idiot husband's return. 'less you've seen him, we don't have much to discuss.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: There must be something else you're up to.
100.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

169.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
169.text: Like I told you already - I'm waiting for that lummox, Baelen. The rest is my own business.

31.speaker: Player
31.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

7.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
7.text: Bald. Blue tunic. Dumb as a stick.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: I met him in a field of deadly mushrooms. He died there.
183.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

234.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
234.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

207.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
207.text: Worthless old fool. He had one bleedin' job.
207.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

230.speaker: Player
230.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

187.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
187.text: My husband. Eighty soggin' years together, and he leaves me in the lurch like this.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: No love lost between the two of you, I gather.
10.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

132.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
132.text: Baelen was a rotten old bastard. Treated me like an old shoe for seventy years before his mind started to go - softened him up, made him realise how much he needed me.

152.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
152.text: Losing his mind was the only good he ever did by me.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: What are you doing down here?
88.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

195.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
195.text: Collecting noblestalk. Valuable mushroom. We've a shop in Baldur's Gate. The locals go mad for it.
195.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

29.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
29.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

64.speaker: Player
64.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

222.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
222.text: Ah. To no surprise of mine, you're more competent than Baelen.
222.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

223.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
223.text: Go on, then. Hand it over.
223.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: How much is it worth to you?

113.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
113.text: Loads. But I haven't got anything to offer for it. I'm counting on this shroom for that.

23.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
23.text: Thanking you. I'll be on my way then.

160.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
160.context: NodeContext: Turns back to the player after making to leave.

251.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
251.text: I do thank you. Come visit me in Baldur's Gate if you find yourself that way. We - I - run a shop called Bonecloak's.

225.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
225.text: Baelen nearly sunk the shop to pay for drink, when he was of his own mind. This might allow me to hang on a little longer.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Why do you need it so badly?

44.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
44.text: We - I - run a shop called Bonecloak's in Baldur's Gate.

196.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
196.text: Baelen nearly sunk the shop to pay for drink, when he was of his own mind.

65.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
65.text: If I can put noblestalk on the shelves, it might allow me to hang on a little longer.

267.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
267.text: I thank you. Truly I do.

78.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
78.text: You've sunk me. You and Baelen together.

81.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
81.text: No point in wasting any more time here with you.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: That's more like it. I want you to beg.

35.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
35.text: All right... please. That mushroom could change everything for me.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Hold out the noblestalk to her.

90.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
90.text: Oh. Thank you. I owe you more than you know.

30.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
30.text: Come visit me in Baldur's Gate if you find yourself that way. Might be I can repay your kindness.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Not good enough. Give me something, or I'll toss you into a chasm.

15.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
15.text: Stop! Fine - take this. Wedding ring from a pillock. It has to be worth something.

142.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
142.text: Stop! Fine - take this. Wedding ring from a pillock. It has to be worth something.

261.speaker: Player
261.text: Give her the noblestalk in return.

260.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
260.text: I'd say it was a pleasure doing business, 'cept it wasn't. Off you go.

257.speaker: Player
257.text: Take the reward and keep the noblestalk.

82.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
82.text: You thievin' mudsucker! I hope a cave-in breaks every bone in your carcass!

55.text: I'm a businesswoman - I know a bluff when I hear it. Hand over the 'shroom or clear off.

272.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
272.text: I'm a businesswoman - I know a bluff when I hear it. Hand over the 'shroom or clear off.

271.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
271.text: Fine, go ahead. I'll find a way to fish it back out, or get another.

220.speaker: Player
220.text: Not good enough. Give me something, or this noblestalk disappears right before your eyes.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I know exactly what you owe. Pay up.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: I've changed my mind. I'm keeping it.

171.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
171.text: Wretch! I did as you asked - I hope you fall down a hole and rot!

278.speaker: Player
278.text: Your grovelling needs work. I'm keeping this mushroom for myself.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Sounds like you'll be willing to pay me for it then.

198.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
198.text: Can't. Got nothing to give. Maybe if you came to see me after, in Baldur's Gate...

204.speaker: Player
204.text: What makes this mushroom so valuable?

244.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
244.text: I've yet met an ailment it couldn't help - baldness, blindness, poison, piles...

164.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
164.text: ... and best of all, it cures my dangerously underweight purse.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Could it cure Baelen's memory loss?

168.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
168.text: Probably. But Baelen in his right mind wasn't worth half a half of noblestalk.

122.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
122.text: I knew him better than anyone. Got the scars to prove it.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: There's a sick gnome just over there. Could it cure her?

258.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
258.text: Might do. But why bother? Thing sells in town for enough to make your eyes bulge.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Using nature's gifts to fatten your purse is unseemly.

138.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
138.text: It's a mushroom. It won't leave any starving orphans behind.

177.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
177.text: Now my purse - that is starving. Needs all the fattening it can get.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I've heard it has uses as a remedy.

180.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
180.text: Once I get my hands on it, it'll remedy my flagging coffers.

153.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
153.text: Nearly nothing it can't cure. Blindness, poison, hair loss...

120.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
120.text: I'll find my way out. No point hanging around this den of misery.

248.speaker: Player
248.text: Now that's settled, what are you really doing down here?

137.speaker: Player
137.text: I met him in a field of deadly mushrooms.
137.context: NodeContext: with real bitterness in her voice.

205.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
205.text: Bibberbang. That stupid old fool. He should know better.
205.context: NodeContext: with real bitterness in her voice.

253.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
253.text: My useless husband. Sent him for an errand; it's no surprise he's made a mess of it.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: Thought you should know. I'll try and get him out of there.

231.speaker: Player
231.text: I could help him - for a price.

259.speaker: Player
259.text: No love lost between you two, clearly.

143.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
143.text: Love? Hah. Never heard of it.

62.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
62.text: Did it look like he'd make it out of them bibberbang?

178.speaker: Player
178.text: I freed Baelen already. He should be back soon.

106.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
106.text: Well that's something at least. Of course that old bugger needed help with a simple job...

203.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
203.text: Good. Gods help us both if I came all the way down here for nothin'.

215.speaker: Player
215.text: No idea. I left it up to fate.

200.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
200.text: Right. Well. I'll wait a bit longer. He'll find his way out, or he won't.

130.speaker: Player
130.context: NodeContext: Caught the player in a lie.

209.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
209.text: My useless husband. Sent him for an errand; it's no surprise he's made a mess of it.

16.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
16.text: Knock yourself out. But don't come begging for coin if you find him.

192.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
192.text: If you try to ransom him to me, you'll find yourself skint and stuck with a fat old lout.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I could look for him - for a price.

173.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
173.text: Please. I know better than to promise coin to a stranger.

83.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
83.text: He'll find his own way out, or he won't.

125.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
125.text: I'll wait a little longer. What a bleedin' waste it'd be to come all the way down here for nothing.

60.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
60.text: Bald. Blue tunic. Dumb as a stick.

20.speaker: Player
20.context: NodeContext: Caught the player in a lie.

128.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
128.text: Where? Ach, never mind. Idiot's probably wandered someplace else since.
128.context: NodeContext: Caught the player in a lie.

161.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
161.text: Where? Ach, never mind. Idiot's probably wandered someplace else since.

77.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
77.text: You see him again, tell him to get back here to me. He's overdue as it is.

163.text: And his pet squirrel? He goes nowhere without that little fluffball on his shoulder.
163.context: NodeContext: Caught the player in a lie.

235.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
235.text: And his pet squirrel? He goes nowhere without that little fluffball on his shoulder.
235.context: NodeContext: Caught the player in a lie.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: Indeed. I saw both dwarf and squirrel, in the flesh.
212.context: NodeContext: Caught the player in a lie.

266.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
266.text: Baelen ain't got a pet squirrel and you ain't seem him, have you? Forget it.
266.context: NodeContext: Caught the player in a lie.

131.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
131.text: Oh is that right? What colour's his tunic then?
131.context: NodeContext: Caught the player in a lie.

101.speaker: Player
101.context: NodeContext: Caught the player in a lie.

85.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
85.text: Rubbish - you haven't seen him, have you? Forget it.
85.context: NodeContext: Caught the player in a lie.

274.speaker: Player
274.text: Green. With a very fine weave.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Actually, I was mistaken. I haven't seen him.

233.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
233.text: Oh, an honest mistake, was it? Never mind.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Don't know. Don't care. Don't like your questions.

56.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
56.text: Don't like having a sour-breath grey in my face myself, but here we are.

155.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
155.text: Now answer the question or find another cranny to skulk in.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Watch your tongue - you have no power here.

201.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
201.text: Aye, but them myconids do, and they won't take too kindly to you kicking up a fuss. So like I said - play nice.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I'm not truly a duergar - merely disguised.

71.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
71.text: Hrrm. Clever disguise as long as it works. Stupid beyond belief as soon as it stops.

276.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
276.text: You're daft enough to get on with Baelen. Speaking of, you haven't answered my question - seen him?

193.speaker: Player
193.text: I'm not truly a drow - merely disguised.

239.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
239.text: You don't know what you've done. Leave me be.
239.context: NodeContext: Player cured Baelen. She's facing a terrible future.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: You could always just leave him.

237.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
237.text: You don't understand. You don't know what he's capable of.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Maybe I can help you get away from him.

252.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
252.text: You're just like him. Everyone is, in the end.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: It's your own fault - you took advantage of Baelen while he was unwell.

133.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
133.text: Me mistreating him. You're just like him. Everyone is, in the end.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: I know exactly what I've done. Very entertaining.

227.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
227.text: You're a beast - you and Baelen  would make fine bedfellows.

126.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
126.text: Get out of my face. Find some else's suffering to lap up.

273.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
273.text: We'll be clearing out, soon enough.

264.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
264.text: Unless you want to take that lump with you, seeing as you've got the ring he gave me.

256.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
256.text: No? Thought not. Clear off then.
